item.title: Final ADVANTAGE Project Event in Seville, Spain
item.description: The University of Seville hosted the final ADVANTAGE event during 28-29th of September. Along with the training activities, a feedback session was organized where the early-stage researchers shared their overall experiences of the project and provided their feedback to the Project Coordinator and their supervisors.

item.title: Project ADVANTAGE at IEEE ICC 2017, Paris, France
item.description:
In the context of the IEEE International Conference on Communications, 21st – 25th May 2017, the workshop included:

  • Two plenary talks from Prof. Petar Popovski from Aalborg University, Denmark and Prof. Andrea Tonello from the University of Klagenfurt, Austria.
  • A poster session.
  • Demonstrations.
  • Discussion on future research directions.

item.title: Visiting Researcher at Aalborg University, Denmark
item.description: I visited the MassM2M research group at Aalborg University from May to July 2017. I worked on code-expanded random access schemes for massive machine-type communications under the supervision of Dr. Cedomir Stefanovic and Dr. Petar Popovski.

item.title: Smart Grid seminar at the Royal Society, London
item.description:
One day Research Seminar held at the Royal Society in London on 28th October 2016, attended by forty three delegates. The event gathered together leading names in the field of Smart Grid development including notable academics, industrialists and international research groups.

Talks were given as follows:

-Alastair Martin, Flexitricity
“An Overview of Demand Response for the Smart Grid”

-Damien Ernst, University of Liège
“Active network management for Distribution Network: an integrated approach”

-Stephen McArthur, University of Strathclyde
“Distributed Intelligence and Analytics for improved Operation of Power Networks”

-Dimitrios Rovas, University College London
“Model-based energy management in non-residential Buildings”

-Andres Laya, Wireless@KTH:
“Interdisciplinary Research in the Internet of Things (IoT)”

and a panel session on Future Research Challenges for Smart Grid with the external speakers as panellists, also joined by Gordon Parker of Michigan Technological University.
